channel.title: Rmarkdown on Justin Minsk's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Rmarkdown on Justin Minsk's Blog

item.title: Python in RMarkdown
item.description: Python in RStudio Python blocks of code can be written in Rmarkdown and knited with knitr. For example: python_string = "Hello World" print(python_string) ## Hello World However, unlike R code blocks the data does not transfer from code block to code block. This means you must import packages and data every code block. This is fine for some short examples or for a graph, but this will get tiresome and wordy very quickly if you want to explain more than one step in-depth.
